args.natural_language_statement: Suppose R ⊆ ℝ^n is a closed rectangle with one side of length 0. For every bounded function f : R → ℝ, show that f is Riemann integrable on R and ∫_R f = 0.

retrieved_examples.nl: If a and b are real numbers with a = b, then any bounded function f : [a,b] → ℝ is Riemann integrable and its integral is 0.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

theorem interval_of_zero_length_integral {a b : ℝ} (h : a = b) (f : Set.Icc a b → ℝ) (hbounded : Bounded (Set.range f)) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn f (Set.Icc a b) ∧ RiemannIntegral f (Set.Icc a b) = 0 := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

theorem rectangle_zero_side_rintegral {n : ℕ} {a b : Fin n → ℝ} (i : Fin n) (h : a i = b i)
  (f : (Fin n → ℝ) → ℝ) (hbound : Bounded (Set.range f)) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn f (Set.Icc a b) ∧ RiemannIntegral f (Set.Icc a b) = 0 := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set

/-- Placeholder constants for Riemann integrability and integral. -/
constant IsRiemannIntegrableOn {α : Type _} (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : Prop
constant RiemannIntegral {α : Type _} (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : ℝ

/-- If a closed rectangle in ℝ^n has one side of length 0, then any bounded
function on that rectangle is Riemann integrable and its integral is 0. -/
theorem rectangle_zero_side_rintegral {n : ℕ} {a b : Fin n → ℝ} (i : Fin n) (h : a i = b i)
  (α := { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Icc a b })
  (f : α → ℝ) (hbound : Bounded (range f)) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn f (univ : Set α) ∧ RiemannIntegral f (univ : Set α) = 0 := by sorry

open Set

/-- Placeholder constants for Riemann integrability and integral. -/
constant IsRiemannIntegrableOn {α : Type _} (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : Prop
constant RiemannIntegral {α : Type _} (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : ℝ

/-- If a closed rectangle in ℝ^n has one side of length 0, then any bounded
function on that rectangle is Riemann integrable and its integral is 0. -/
theorem rectangle_zero_side_rintegral {n : ℕ} {a b : Fin n → ℝ} (i : Fin n) (h : a i = b i)
  (α := { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Icc a b })
  (f : α → ℝ) (hbound : Bounded (range f)) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn f (univ : Set α) ∧ RiemannIntegral f (univ : Set α) = 0 := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

constant IsRiemannIntegrableOn {α : Type _} (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : Prop
constant RiemannIntegral {α : Type _} (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : ℝ

theorem rectangle_zero_side_rintegral {n : ℕ} {a b : Fin n → ℝ} (i : Fin n) (h : a i = b i)
  (f : { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Set.Icc a b } → ℝ) (hbound : True) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn f (Set.univ : Set { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Set.Icc a b }) ∧
  RiemannIntegral f (Set.univ : Set { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Set.Icc a b }) = 0 := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

axiom IsRiemannIntegrableOn (α : Type _) (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : Prop
axiom riemannIntegral (α : Type _) (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : ℝ

theorem rectangle_zero_side_rintegral {n : ℕ} {a b : Fin n → ℝ} (i : Fin n) (h : a i = b i)
  (f : { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Icc a b } → ℝ) (hbound : Bounded (range f)) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn _ f (univ : Set { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Icc a b }) ∧
  riemannIntegral _ f (univ : Set { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Icc a b }) = 0 := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set

axiom IsRiemannIntegrableOn (α : Type _) (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : Prop
axiom riemannIntegral (α : Type _) (f : α → ℝ) (s : Set α) : ℝ

theorem rectangle_zero_side_rintegral {n : ℕ} {a b : Fin n → ℝ} (i : Fin n) (h : a i = b i)
  (f : { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Set.Icc a b } → ℝ) :
  IsRiemannIntegrableOn _ f (Set.univ : Set { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Set.Icc a b }) ∧
  riemannIntegral _ f (Set.univ : Set { x : Fin n → ℝ // x ∈ Set.Icc a b }) = 0 := by sorry
